required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Cetuximab, Paclitaxel, Carboplatin And Radiation For Esophageal, Gastroesophageal Junction And Gastric Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: BrUOG-E/G-203 CETUXIMAB, PACLITAXEL, CARBOPLATIN AND RADIATION FOR ESOPHAGEAL, GASTROESOPHAGEAL JUNCTION AND GASTRIC CANCER

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: Phase II study of cetuximab, paclitaxel, carboplatin and radiation for esophageal cancer.

detailed_description.textblock: Cetuximab, paclitaxel, carboplatin weekly for 6 weeks with 50.4 Gy.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with clinical complete response change from treatment to follow-up
primary_outcome.time_frame: completion of chemo/radiation and 6 months post drug

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with toxicity throughout study treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: weekly during chemo/radiation and at completion of chemo/radiation and during follow-up for surivival (maximum of 5 years)

arm_group.description: cetuximab, paclitaxel, and carboplatin weekly for 6 weeks with 50.4 Gy radiation.

intervention.other_name: Cetuximab, paclitaxel, carboplatin and radiation then surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- nonmetastatic esophageal or gastric cancer
Exclusion Criteria:
metastatic disease -
